description: ZSNES provides numerous save states from 0 to 99 (file extensions .ZS0 , ZS1, .ZS2 , and so on). They can be saved using the "Save State" option under the "Game" menu.

NOTE: ZSNES save states are different than in-game save states. ZSNES save states may be created at any point during gameplay whereas in-game save states typically are controlled by the progress within the game.
